SystemColors Class

In this Article

Contains system colors, system brushes, and system resource keys that correspond to system display elements.

XAML Text Usage

You cannot declare this managed class in XAML, but you can use its static properties to assign values in XAML.

Properties

  • ActiveBorderBrush

    Gets a SolidColorBrush that is the color of the active window's border.

    public static System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush ActiveBorderBrush { get; }

    Property Value

    • SolidColorBrush

      A SolidColorBrush with its stem.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush.Color* set to the color of the active window's border. The returned brush's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is true, so it cannot be modified.

    Remarks

    XAML Attribute Usage

    <object property="{x:Static SystemColors.ActiveBorderBrush}"/>

    XAML Values

    x:Static
    The x:Static Markup Extension.

  • ActiveBorderBrushKey

    Gets the ResourceKey for the SolidColorBrush used to paint the active window's border.

    public static System.Windows.ResourceKey ActiveBorderBrushKey { get; }

    Property Value

    • ResourceKey

      The resource key for the SolidColorBrush used to paint the active window's border. This brush's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is true, so it cannot be modified.

    Remarks

    Use the ActiveBorderBrushKey to create a dynamic reference to the active border system brush. This dynamic reference will automatically update if the brush is changed. To create a static reference that does not update automatically, use ActiveBorderBrush.

    XAML Attribute Usage

    <object property="{DynamicResource {x:Static SystemColors.ActiveBorderBrushKey}}"/>

    XAML Values

    x:Static
    The x:Static Markup Extension.
